author: Ted Mann
title: Amtrak May Suspend Use of Tracks Without Crash-Prevention Systems
text:
WASHINGTON—Amtrak on Thursday threatened to suspend operations on some tracks it uses outside the Northeast Corridor if the track owners don’t meet a year-end federal deadline to install crash-prevention systems.
In testimony before a House subcommittee hearing on delays in installing the systems, Amtrak chief executive Richard Anderson said the railroad will meet the December 2018 deadline to have so-called positive train control, or PTC, operating on the tracks and trains it owns, including the Northeast Corridor, where...
